Consolidate.definition: to join together into one whole

-dat·ing.definition: to join together into one whole

sub_terms.a: to combine (two or more lawsuits or matters that involve a common question of law or fact) into one compare
sub_terms.b: to combine (two or more corporations) to form one new corporation compare

-dat·ing.note: Consolidation of matters in the federal courts is governed by Rule 42 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure. Consolidated cases may become one single action with a single judgment, or may retain their individual identities although tried together. The court may also try one representative case and render a judgment binding on the other cases.
